de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.layout

Interface TabSwitcherLayout

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTabSwitcherLayout, PhoneTabSwitcherLayout, TabletTabSwitcherLayout, TabSwitcher

    public interface TabSwitcherLayout
    Defines the interface, a layout, which implements the functionality of a TabSwitcher, must implement.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      android.view.ViewGroup getTabContainer()
      Returns the view group, which contains the tab switcher's tabs.
      android.view.Menu getToolbarMenu()
      Returns the menu of the toolbar, which is shown, when the tab switcher is shown.
      android.support.v7.widget.Toolbar[] getToolbars()
      Returns the toolbars, which are shown, when the tab switcher is shown.
      boolean isAnimationRunning()
      Returns, whether an animation is currently running, or not.

    • Method Detail

      • isAnimationRunning

        boolean isAnimationRunning()
        Returns, whether an animation is currently running, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if an animation is currently running, false otherwise

      • getTabContainer

        @Nullable
android.view.ViewGroup getTabContainer()
        Returns the view group, which contains the tab switcher's tabs.
        Returns:
        The view group, which contains the tab switcher's tabs, as an instance of the class ViewGroup or null, if the view has not been laid out yet

      • getToolbars

        @Nullable
android.support.v7.widget.Toolbar[] getToolbars()
        Returns the toolbars, which are shown, when the tab switcher is shown. When using the smartphone layout, only one toolbar is shown. When using the tablet layout, a primary and secondary toolbar is shown. In such case, the index TabSwitcher.PRIMARY_TOOLBAR_INDEX of the returned array corresponds to the primary toolbar and the index TabSwitcher.SECONDARY_TOOLBAR_INDEX corresponds to the secondary toolbar.
        Returns:
        An array, which contains the toolbars, which are shown, when the tab switcher is shown, as an array of the type Toolbar or null, if the view has not been laid out yet

      • getToolbarMenu

        @Nullable
android.view.Menu getToolbarMenu()
        Returns the menu of the toolbar, which is shown, when the tab switcher is shown. When using the tablet layout, the menu corresponds to the secondary toolbar.
        Returns:
        The menu of the toolbar as an instance of the type Menu or null, if the view has not been laid out yet
